The curators played a key role in the insertion of new narratives and themes in all forty works by participating artists. “Art Basel Hong Kong’s thirty-ninth edition will bring together a special selection of new and established international artists, or present works from the 2010 and 2012 editions,” said Nilsen. The National Museum of American Art (NMA) in Washington, DC, announced today that it is currently closed until March 18 because of the Covid-19 pandemic. The institution is working with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), the Food and Drug Administration (FDA), and the National Institutes of Health (NIH) to assess if it can reopen. According to the Washington Post, the CDC plans to open the museum in March, and the FDA expects to open the institution in March at the earliest.If the CDC and the FDA are successful in reopening the museum, it will be able to welcome visitors again. Since March is the worst month for Covid-19 to strike the United States, the museum will not be able to welcome the public until May 6.
